meanings.definition: A person who is arrogant or conceited.
meanings.sent1: Some people don't like to be around swellheads because they always talk about themselves.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reminded the students not to be swellheads and to treat everyone with kindness.
meanings.sent3: The swellheads at the party kept interrupting others to talk about their accomplishments.
meanings.sent4: Her boss's swellhead attitude made it difficult for others to work with him.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain as a swellhead who thought he was better than everyone else.

meanings.sent1: If you blow too much air into the balloon, it will swellheads and pop.
meanings.sent2: The frog's throat would swellheads when it croaked loudly.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to swellheads as the clown kept blowing air into it.
meanings.sent4: The pastry dough will swellheads in the oven before it is ready to be baked.
meanings.sent5: The tire began to swellheads as the air compressor filled it with more air.

meanings.definition: To be filled with pride or self-importance.
meanings.sent1: After winning the competition, he started to swellheads with pride.
meanings.sent2: She tried not to let success make her swellheads and lose sight of what was important.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to swellheads with self-importance after catching a mouse.
meanings.sent4: His ego would swellheads whenever someone praised his work.
meanings.sent5: The team's victory made them swellheads with confidence for the upcoming match.
